prompt: In a conditional proof, to prove (P → Q), we:
options: Derive both P and Q separately
hint: We temporarily assume the antecedent and show the consequent follows.
explanation: Conditional Proof (CP): To prove (P → Q), assume P (in a subproof), derive Q, then discharge the assumption to conclude (P → Q). This mirrors the definition of implication: IF P is true, THEN Q follows.
visual_concept: Building a bridge: Assume you're at point P. Show you can reach Q from there. The bridge (P → Q) is now built.
